==Events==
*  [[70]] &ndash; [[Titus]] and his [[Roman Empire|Roman]] [[Roman army|legion]]s breach the middle wall of [[Jerusalem]] in the [[Siege of Jerusalem (70)|Siege of Jerusalem]].
*[[1257]] &ndash; [[Kraków]], in Poland, receives [[city rights]].
*[[1283]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Gulf of Naples]]: [[Roger of Lauria]], admiral to King [[Peter III of Aragon]], captures [[Charles II of Naples|Charles of Salermo]].
*[[1625]] &ndash; The city of [[Breda]] surrenders to the [[Tercio|Spanish tercios]] under general [[Ambrogio Spinola, 1st Marquis of the Balbases|Ambrosio Spinola]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Battle of New Ross (1798)|The Battle of New Ross]]: The attempt to spread the [[Irish Rebellion of 1798|United Irish Rebellion]] into [[Munster]] is defeated.
*[[1817]] &ndash; The first [[Great Lakes]] steamer, the [[PS Frontenac|''Frontenac'']], is launched.
*[[1829]] &ndash; {{HMS|Pickle}} captures the armed slave ship ''Voladora'' off the coast of [[Cuba]].
*[[1832]] &ndash; The [[June Rebellion]] breaks out in Paris in an attempt to overthrow the monarchy of [[Louis Philippe]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Houston]] is incorporated by the [[Republic of Texas]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; Denmark becomes a [[constitutional monarchy]] by the signing of a new [[Constitution of Denmark|constitution]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[Harriet Beecher Stowe]]'s anti-[[slavery]] serial, ''[[Uncle Tom's Cabin]]'', or ''Life Among the Lowly'', starts a ten-month run in the ''National Era'' [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionist]] newspaper.
*[[1862]] &ndash; As the [[Treaty of Saigon]] is signed, ceding parts of southern [[Vietnam]] to France, the guerrilla leader [[Trương Định]] decides to defy Emperor [[Tự Đức]] of Vietnam and fight on against the Europeans.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Piedmont]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces under [[General]] [[David Hunter]] defeat a [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] army at [[Piedmont, Augusta County, Virginia|Piedmont, Virginia]], taking nearly 1,000 prisoners.
*[[1883]] &ndash; The first regularly scheduled [[Orient Express]] departs Paris.
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[1888 Río de la Plata earthquake|Rio de la Plata Earthquake]] takes place.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: British soldiers take [[Pretoria]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; Denmark amends its [[constitution of Denmark|constitution]] to allow [[women's suffrage]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Louis Brandeis]] is sworn in as a [[Past Justices of the Supreme Court of the United States|Justice of the United States Supreme Court]]; he is the first [[History of Jews in the United States|American Jew]] to hold such a position.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Conscription]] begins in the United States as "Army registration day".
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] abrogates the United States' use of the [[gold standard]] by enacting a joint resolution (48 Stat. 112) nullifying the right of creditors to demand payment in [[gold]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: After a brief lull in the [[Battle of France]], the Germans renew the offensive against the remaining French divisions south of the [[River Somme]] in Operation ''[[Fall Rot]]'' ("Case Red").
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: Four thousand [[Chongqing]] residents are [[asphyxia|asphyxiated]] in a bomb shelter during the [[Bombing of Chongqing]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The United States declares war on [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]], [[Kingdom of Hungary|Hungary]], and [[Kingdom of Romania|Romania]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: More than 1000 British bombers drop 5,000 tons of bombs on [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Atlantic Wall|gun batteries]] on the [[Normandy]] coast in preparation for [[D-Day]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Allied Control Council]], the military occupation governing body of Germany, formally takes power.
*[[1946]] &ndash; A fire in the [[La Salle Hotel]] in Chicago, [[Illinois]], kills 61 people.<!--Resulted in laws and policy change; notable-->
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Marshall Plan]]: In a speech at [[Harvard University]], the [[United States Secretary of State]] [[George Marshall]] calls for economic aid to war-torn Europe.
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Thailand]] elects [[Orapin Chaiyakan]], the first [[Women in Thailand|female]] member of [[Thailand's Parliament]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Elvis Presley]] introduces his new single, "[[Hound Dog (song)|Hound Dog]]", on ''[[The Milton Berle Show]]'', scandalizing the audience with his suggestive hip movements.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The first government of the [[Singapore|State of Singapore]] is sworn in.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The British [[Secretary of State for War]], [[John Profumo]], resigns in a [[sex scandal]] known as the "[[Profumo affair]]".
*  1963   &ndash; [[Movement of 15 Khordad]]: Protests against the arrest of [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] by the [[Shah]] of [[Iran]], [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi]]. In several cities, masses of angry demonstrators are confronted by tanks and [[paratrooper]]s.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[DSV Alvin|DSV ''Alvin'']] is commissioned.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Six-Day War]] begins: [[Israel]] launches surprise strikes against [[Egypt]]ian air-fields in response to the mobilisation of Egyptian forces on the Israeli border.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Robert F. Kennedy]], a U.S. presidential candidate, is [[Assassination of Robert F. Kennedy|shot]] at the [[Ambassador Hotel (Los Angeles)|Ambassador Hotel]] in [[Los Angeles]], by [[Sirhan Sirhan]], a Palestinian. Kennedy dies the next day.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The [[1969 International Meeting of Communist and Workers Parties|International communist conference]] begins in Moscow.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Suez Canal]] opens for the first time since the Six-Day War.
*  1975   &ndash; The United Kingdom holds its first country-wide [[United Kingdom European Communities membership referendum, 1975|referendum]] on remaining in the [[European Economic Community]] (EEC).
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[Teton Dam]] in [[Idaho]], United States, collapases.
*[[1977]] &ndash; A [[coup]] takes place in [[Seychelles]].
<!--*  1977   &ndash; The [[Apple II]], one of the first [[personal computers]], goes on sale.--><!--[[Apple II]] mentioned June 10-->
*[[1981]] &ndash; The "[[Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report]]" of the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] reports that five people in Los Angeles, California, have a rare form of [[pneumonia]] seen only in patients with weakened [[immune system]]s, in what turns out to be the first recognized cases of [[AIDS]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[Prime Minister of India]], [[Indira Gandhi]], orders an attack on the [[Harmandir Sahib|Golden Temple]], the holiest site of the [[Sikh]] religion.
*[[1989]] &ndash; The [[Tank Man]] halts the progress of a column of advancing tanks for over half an hour after the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; Portions of the [[Holbeck Hall Hotel]] in [[Scarborough, North Yorkshire|Scarborough]], in [[North Yorkshire]], England, fall into the sea following a landslide.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Bose–Einstein condensate]] is first created.
*[[1998]] &ndash; A [[Strike action|strike]] begins at the [[General Motors]] parts factory in [[Flint, Michigan]], that quickly spreads to five other assembly plants. The strike lasts seven weeks.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[Six-Day War (2000)|Six-Day War in Kisangani]] begins in [[Kisangani]], in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], between [[Uganda]]n and [[Rwanda]]n forces. A large part of the city is destroyed.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Tropical Storm Allison]] makes landfall on the upper-[[Texas]] coastline as a strong tropical storm and dumps large amounts of rain over Houston. The storm causes $5.5 billion in damages, making Allison the costliest tropical storm in U.S. history.
*[[2003]] &ndash; A severe [[heat wave]] across [[Pakistan]] and India reaches its peak, as temperatures exceed 50°C (122°F) in the region.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Serbia]] declares independence from the [[State Union of Serbia and Montenegro]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; After 65 straight days of civil disobedience, at least 31 people [[2009 Peruvian political crisis|are killed]] in clashes between security forces and indigenous people near [[Bagua, Peru]].
